abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated satisfactory
            and project sustainability is likely. Overall World Bank
            performance during project preparation and supervision was
            satisfactory. Likewise, Borrower performance was considered
            satisfactory overall in that despite the implementation
            difficulties and issues during the early phase, the project
            succeeded in achieving its objectives. The following lessons
            proved valuable: Strong ownership and active participation
            of local stakeholders assures the success of the project. A
            strong central implementing agency characterized by
            dedicated and decisive leadership is needed to guide and
            coordinate provincial implementation and ensure timely
            execution of project activities. A clearly articulated
            communication should also be in place to ensure an effective
            two-way information flow, from and to the center, the
            province, and the project institutions. Institutional
            capacity to manage a large and complex project should be
            assessed at appraisal. Action plans for the first year
            should be one of the requirements for negotiations. Agencies
            should receive adequate training and guidance and be
            familiar with operational procedures and principles
            including project management, disbursement, monitoring and
            evaluation, and project reporting. Other areas needing
            priority attention are procurement planning, monitoring and
            evaluation, supporting a commitment to research, and using
            well-designed and implemented innovations to impact
            education policymaking.
